titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Education and Culture Program, Office Files of Linn F.C. Cary
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Education and Culture Program, Office Files of Linn F.C. Cary FA533

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-01 01:47:06 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Education and Culture Program, Office Files of Linn F.C. Cary

physdesc.extent: 12 standard record storage boxes and 1 letter document box.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files span Cary's career at Ford and the variety of roles and activities.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Linn F.C. Cary Mehta is a university literature lecturer who worked for several years at the Ford Foundation. She started as an Assistant to the President at the Ford Foundation and then moved into the U.S. and International Affairs Program, Education and Culture Program.
Cary's career as a university lecturer has included her positions at Columbia University and Vassar College. She started lecturing in Barnard College's English department in 2000.

Cary earned a B.A. in English and French literature from Yale University in 1977 and a M.A. in English language and literature from Oxford University in 1979. She earned a M.Phil and Ph.D. in comparative literature from Columbia University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.
